result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley Nichole Bougie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ashley Nichole Bougie is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ashley Nichole Bougie was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: any other probationary sentence.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with Kristie Hoyer or any other known drug users or dealers.
No possession of a controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 
Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 
Maintain Absolute Sobriety 
2 days credit if probation is revoked.

timeConds.notes: STAYED, to be used at the agent's discretion.

9:06 AM Defendant Ashley Nichole Bougie in court.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court for Ashley Nichole Bougie.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin.  ADA Schieffer: guilty to Ct#1, dismiss ct#2. Impose 12 months jail, stayed orders 2 years probation: court costs ($518), Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no contact with Kristie Hoyer or other known drug users, 90 days jail stayed to be used at the agent's discretion. Atty Helgeson and Def agree.Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#1. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#1 and dismisses Ct#2. ADA Schieffer and Atty Helgeson address sentencing - joint recommendation. Court imposes 12 months jail stayed orders 2 years probation; concurrent to any other sentence- 90 days jail stayed to be used at the agents discretion, court costs ($518), no contact with Kristie Hoyer or any known drug users or dealer, no possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription, Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Provide DNA sample within 30 days.  Maintain Absolute Sobriety, 2 days credit if probation is revoked. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Defendant to report to DOC office today. 9:
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 21, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court adjourned at 1:09 pm.

1:02 PM Defendant Ashley Nichole Bougie appears from Jail in person, Atty Philip A. Helgeson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Sgt Cole Clemets. S/T. ADA Schieffer questions Sgt Clemets. Court reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Helgeson. ADA Schieffer is asking the Court find probable cause and bind DE over.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 11:45 am.

3:04 PM Defendant Ashley Nichole Bougie appears from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $5,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS, not to possess and NC w/KH, no objection. Court so orders. Atty Nelson needs more information to see if DE qualifies for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:11 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
